page.title: $.parseJSON() - Minified.js
page.main:
back to Overview

$.parseJSON()

Parses a string containing JSON and returns the de-serialized object.

Syntax

$.parseJSON(text)

Parameters

text
the JSON string
(return value)
the resulting JavaScript object. Undefined if not valid.

Description

Parses a string containing JSON and returns the de-serialized object. If JSON.parse is defined, which it is in pretty all browsers except Internet Explorer 7 and earlier, it will be used. This is mainly to prevent possible security problems caused by the use of eval in the implementation. Only in browsers without JSON.parse Minified's own implementation will be used.

If you use a Minified build without Internet Explorer 7 compatibility, JSON.parse will always be used.

Example

Parsing a JSON string: 

var jsonString = "{name: 'Fruits', roles: ['apple', 'banana', 'orange']}";
var myObj = $.parseJSON(jsonString);
